title: Election Commission censures Lalu and Sharad Yadav
text:
The election commission has served a show cause notice to Janta Dal (U) president, Sharad Yadav asking him to explain his objectionable comment made during election meeting in Nalanda on October 7.
Citing report from chief electoral officer (CEO), Bihar, the election commission questioned Sharad Yadav on his remark in which he said, "If you do not fulfill the promise then the Hindu will not go to heaven and the Muslim will not go to Allah in Heaven."
The EC found Sharad Yadav's comment in violation of section of Model Code of Conduct barring parties and candidates to make an appeal to caste or communal feelings for securing votes and also violating the proviso of section 123 of Representation of People's Act that deals with corrupt practice of undue influence when he attempted to induce to believe that he will become or will be rendered an object of divine displeasure or spiritual censure.
In another case, the EC censured RJD supremo Lalu Yadav for falling deficient in denying having made the statements against which the poll watchdog had issued a show cause notice to him on October 1.
Cautioning Lalu Yadav to be more careful in public utterances in future, the poll watchdog said, "the explanation served by you in support of those statements have not been found convincing by the commission, as those statements have the effect of aggravating the differences between different sections of society and also inciting them on grounds of caste and religion."
